snippet: The high-profile group still euthanizes most of the animals at its shelter in Virginia, even as a “no-kill” movement that promotes adoption grows rapidly.
abstract: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals has confounded some people and incensed others because it still euthanizes most of the animals at its shelter in Norfolk, Va, even as major animal protection groups have moved to a 'no-kill' shelter model.
lead_paragraph: The high-profile group still euthanizes most of the animals at its shelter in Virginia, even as a “no-kill” movement that promotes adoption grows rapidly.

headline.main: PETA Finds Itself on Receiving End of Others’ Anger
headline.print_headline: Animal Rights Group Finds Itself On Receiving End of Others’ Anger

keywords.value: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals
keywords.name: organizations
